DOC.brief_summary: This randomized clinical pilot trial design assess feasibility randomize obese woman GDM low glycemic threshold compare standard care . Maternal cord blood metabolic profile , neonatal body composition , maternal sleep quality duration also compare group .
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator randomize 60 obese pregnant woman new diagnosis gestational diabetes use Carpenter-Coustan criterion 1:1 fashion either standard care intensive therapy . Subjects randomize either standard care intensive therapy first study visit , occur 12-32 week gestation complete gestational diabetes test . Neither patient provider blind patient study group . All woman receive standard nutritional counseling time diagnosis , also treat either glyburide insulin dictate standard care . Women return second study visit 32-36 week gestation ass impact glycemic target group overall glycemic control . The investigator also collect information type dose medication require maintain glycemic control woman randomize either standard care intensive therapy . In addition standard glucose monitor 4x/day ( fast one-hour post breakfast , lunch , dinner ) , investigator utilize blind continuous glucose monitor ( iPro , Medtronic ) study visit . Because woman GDM receive active management blood sugar dietary counseling , investigator assess CGM 5 consecutive day study enrollment 32-36 week . Study participant complete food diary CGM monitor correlate food intake glycemic variation . The investigator also compare maternal cord blood metabolic profile , neonatal body composition , maternal sleep quality duration group .
DOC.criteria: maternal age 1845 year singleton birth plan delivery OU Medical Center GDM diagnose 1232 week ' gestation either 50 gram one hour GCT > 200 mg/dL two abnormal value 100 gram OGTT use CarpenterCoustan criterion prepregnancy BMI â‰¥26 kg/m2 . maternal tobacco use plan delivery prior 34 week gestation significant fetal anomaly chronic hypertension require medication vascular disease know renal disease baseline serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL maternal rheumatologic disorder require medication maternal human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) hepatitis specimen storage facility accredit handle sample steroid use within 7 day .
